After 6 years of buying this game I can finally write a review for this piece of crap. I don't know why I paid a lot of money for this garbage game when I was a student.
This game is so lack of content. There are no updates for new maps, new heroes or any new events. The events are same every year, they haven't changed since the first year, the only thing that has changed is the skins. 
And this new event "Invasion", you have to pay to play the game mode that has been in the game for so many years, just with the new skins for the mobs.
Therefore, I sincerely recommend that you DON'T PLAY THIS GAME. Even if you want to play it, don't pay for it.
my new beloved game. BEST FPS GAME! I LOVE BLIZZARD!

Honest review from a long time player: Negatives - Overwatch 1 was 10x better. The monetization is not okay in this game. I poured so many hours into Overwatch 1 even when it got no updates for a while. But they literally took every good thing (6v6, lootboxes, player levels, gameplay) and just made it into a F2P style. The community can be super toxic and most people just turn off team chat because of it. Removing tank synergies was one of the worst things they have ever done.  Blizzard put the nail in the coffin certifying that the player base will not be getting what they were most hyped for by canceling hero missions and skill trees. I get it, we wouldn't have Overwatch 2 released right now if they didn't cancel them, and Overwatch 1 would die. But we have seen so many games return from the dead after years of no new games or content. Positives - On the bright side the game is super fun with friends and very competitive. It runs well and the graphics are stunning. The heroes and new ones are always a blast to play and it's very fast paced. The competitive ladder is fun to grind with friends and it's not hard to rank up (I'm GM1 peak) The negatives overwhelm the positives but I'm considering just moving to Paladins. If you wan't overwatch with more heroes, very F2P friendly, customizational abilities, and devs that actually care about the game just go play Paladins. TF2 is also a good option but Paladins is the closest to Overwatch. Honestly if the devs stop charging 20$ for a skin that doesn't even change weapon and ability sound effects (which is 10$ in Paladins for skins that do) and overprice the PVE then the game can be saved. I'd recommend giving the game a shot and if you don't like it uninstall, if you do don't spend any money. The best deal you got is the battle pass if you do spend money but I can't control what you buy it's just my recommendation. I hope this helps anyone thinking about picking up the game and that's the most honest I can be. Even after all the bad updates/news I still find myself enjoying this game for what it is (most of the time) which is why I would recommend giving it a chance.
